SENT.plain: Patients with Gilbert syndrome have an impaired function of the enzyme UGT1A1, responsible for the degradation of 4-OH-estrogens
These elements are produced by the degradation of estrogens and are well-known carcinogens
In theory, patients with Gilbert syndrome accumulate 4-OH-estrogens and, therefore, might have a higher risk for breast cancer, especially when exposed to higher levels of estrogens
If this theory is true, a new risk group for breast cancer would be described, producing new insights in breast carcinogenesis
